Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API MAIN¶

Main entry point for the FastAPI application.

This module sets up the FastAPI app instance, configures middleware such as CORS and rate limiting, registers API routers, and defines global exception handlers and utility endpoints.

async main.add_user_email_to_request(request: Request, call_next)[source]¶

Middleware to extract user email from JWT token if present.

Adds user_email to request.state based on the decoded JWT token subject (sub claim). Falls back to client IP address if no valid token is found.

async main.rate_limit_handler(request: Request, exc: RateLimitExceeded)[source]¶

Exception handler for rate limiting errors.

Returns a 429 Too Many Requests response when the user exceeds the rate limit.

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Health check endpoint.

Returns a welcome message if the database connection is successful. Raises 500 if database is not responding or misconfigured.

main.main_root()[source]¶

Root endpoint.

Returns a simple welcome message indicating application version.

REST API CONFIG¶

class src.conf.config.Settings(_case_sensitive: bool | None = None, _nested_model_default_partial_update: bool | None = None, _env_prefix: str | None = None, _env_file: DotenvType | None = WindowsPath('.'), _env_file_encoding: str | None = None, _env_ignore_empty: bool | None = None, _env_nested_delimiter: str | None = None, _env_nested_max_split: int | None = None, _env_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _env_parse_enums: bool | None = None, _cli_prog_name: str | None = None, _cli_parse_args: bool | list[str] | tuple[str, ...] | None = None, _cli_settings_source: CliSettingsSource[Any] | None = None, _cli_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _cli_hide_none_type: bool | None = None, _cli_avoid_json: bool | None = None, _cli_enforce_required: bool | None = None, _cli_use_class_docs_for_groups: bool | None = None, _cli_exit_on_error: bool | None = None, _cli_prefix: str | None = None, _cli_flag_prefix_char: str | None = None, _cli_implicit_flags: bool | None = None, _cli_ignore_unknown_args: bool | None = None, _cli_kebab_case: bool | None = None, _cli_shortcuts: Mapping[str, str | list[str]] | None = None, _secrets_dir: PathType | None = None, *, SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URL: str, MAIL_USERNAME: EmailStr, MAIL_PASSWORD: str, MAIL_FROM: EmailStr, MAIL_PORT: int, MAIL_SERVER: str, MAIL_FROM_NAME: str, MAIL_STARTTLS: bool, MAIL_SSL_TLS: bool, USE_CREDENTIALS: bool, VALIDATE_CERTS: bool, SECRET_KEY: str, ALGORITHM: str, CLOUDINARY_NAME: str, CLOUDINARY_API_KEY: str, CLOUDINARY_API_SECRET: str)[source]¶

Bases: BaseSettings

Configuration settings for the application.

This class loads environment variables from a .env file and provides them as easily accessible attributes. It includes settings for the database, email service, JWT authentication, and Cloudinary integration.

Variables:

  • SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URL (str) – Database connection URL.

  • MAIL_USERNAME (EmailStr) – Username for the email service.

  • MAIL_PASSWORD (str) – Password for the email service.

  • MAIL_FROM (EmailStr) – Sender email address.

  • MAIL_PORT (int) – Port for the email server.

  • MAIL_SERVER (str) – Hostname or IP of the email server.

  • MAIL_FROM_NAME (str) – Display name for the sender email.

  • MAIL_STARTTLS (bool) – Enable STARTTLS for email communication.

  • MAIL_SSL_TLS (bool) – Enable SSL/TLS for email communication.

  • USE_CREDENTIALS (bool) – Use authentication credentials for email.

  • VALIDATE_CERTS (bool) – Validate SSL/TLS certificates for email.

  • SECRET_KEY (str) – Secret key for JWT token signing.

  • ALGORITHM (str) – Algorithm used for JWT token signing (e.g., “HS256”).

  • CLOUDINARY_NAME (str) – Cloudinary cloud name.

  • CLOUDINARY_API_KEY (str) – Cloudinary API key.

  • CLOUDINARY_API_SECRET (str) – Cloudinary API secret.

classmethod validate_algorithm(v: Any)[source]¶

Validates that the ALGORITHM is either “HS256” or “HS512”.

Parameters:

v (Any) – The value of the ALGORITHM field.

Raises:

ValueError – If the algorithm is not “HS256” or “HS512”.

Returns:

The validated algorithm value.

Return type:

Any

src.conf.config.get_settings() → Settings[source]¶

Retrieves the application settings.

This function is cached to ensure that settings are loaded only once.

Returns:

An instance of the Settings class.

Return type:

Settings

REST API DATABASE¶

class src.database.db.Base(**kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: DeclarativeBase

Base class for declarative models.

All SQLAlchemy models in your application should inherit from this class. It provides the necessary metadata for SQLAlchemy to map Python classes to database tables.

metadata: ClassVar[MetaData] = MetaData()¶

Refers to the _schema.MetaData collection that will be used for new _schema.Table objects.

See also

Accessing Table and Metadata

registry: ClassVar[_RegistryType] = <sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.registry object>¶

Refers to the _orm.registry in use where new _orm.Mapper objects will be associated.

src.database.db.get_db()[source]¶

Dependency function to provide a database session.

This function yields a database session that can be used by FastAPI dependency injection. It ensures the session is properly closed after the request is finished, regardless of success or failure.

Yield:

A SQLAlchemy database session.

Return type:

sqlalchemy.orm.Session

REST API ENTITY¶

class src.entity.models.Contact(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Base

Represents a contact entry in the database.

This model stores individual contact details, including personal information, communication details, and a reference to the owning user.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Primary key, unique identifier for the contact.

  • first_name (str) – The first name of the contact.

  • last_name (str) – The last name of the contact.

  • email (str) – The email address of the contact, must be unique across all contacts.

  • phone_number (str, optional) – The phone number of the contact.

  • birthday (datetime.date) – The birthday of the contact.

  • additional_info (str, optional) – Any additional information or notes about the contact.

  • user_id (int) – Foreign key referencing the ID of the user who owns this contact.

  • user (User) – The User object associated with this contact.

id¶
first_name¶
last_name¶
email¶

user_id¶
user¶
class src.entity.models.User(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Base

Represents a user in the application.

This model stores user authentication details, profile information, and manages their associated contacts.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Primary key, unique identifier for the user.

  • username (str) – The user’s chosen username, must be unique.

  • email (str) – The user’s unique email address, used for login.

  • password (str) – Hashed password for the user.

  • refresh_token (str, optional) – Token used to obtain new access tokens without re-authenticating.

  • email_verified (bool) – Boolean indicating if the user’s email has been confirmed.

  • avatar (str, optional) – URL to the user’s profile avatar.

  • contacts (list[Contact]) – A list of contacts associated with this user.

id¶
username¶
email¶
password¶
refresh_token¶
email_verified¶
avatar¶
contacts¶

REST API routes AUTH¶

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Registers a new user account.

This endpoint creates a new user in the database and sends a verification email.

Parameters:

  • body (src.schemas.schemas.UserModel) – User data for registration (username, email, password).

  • bt (fastapi.BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks for sending the email.

  • request (fastapi.Request) – The incoming request object, used to get the base URL for email verification.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 409 Conflict if an account with the given email already exists.

Returns:

A dictionary indicating the email of the newly registered user.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Authenticates a user and provides access and refresh tokens.

This endpoint verifies user credentials and issues JWT tokens for subsequent API access.

Parameters:

  • body (fastapi.security.OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – User credentials (username/email and password). Defaults to OAuth2PasswordRequestForm.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized if email is invalid, email is not verified, or password is incorrect.

Returns:

A dictionary containing access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Refreshes access token using a refresh token.

This endpoint exchanges a valid refresh token for new access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • credentials (fastapi.security.HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – Bearer token containing the refresh token. Defaults to Security(security).

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized if the refresh token is invalid or does not match.

Returns:

A dictionary containing new access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.read_item(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]¶

Accesses a protected resource.

This endpoint requires authentication and demonstrates access to a secret route.

Parameters:

current_user (src.entity.models.User) – The authenticated user obtained from the access token. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Returns:

A dictionary with a message and the owner’s email.

Return type:

dict

src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Confirms a user’s email address using a verification token.

This endpoint is called when a user clicks the verification link in their email.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email verification token.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 400 Bad Request if the token is invalid or verification fails.

Returns:

A dictionary with a confirmation message.

Return type:

dict

REST API routes CONTACTS¶

src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), first_name: str | None = Query(None), last_name: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user, with optional filtering.

This endpoint allows authenticated users to fetch their contacts, optionally filtered by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • current_user (src.entity.models.User) – The authenticated user. Defaults to auth_service.get_current_user.

  • first_name (str, optional) – Optional filter for contact’s first name (case-insensitive search).

  • last_name (str, optional) – Optional filter for contact’s last name (case-insensitive search).

  • email (str, optional) – Optional filter for contact’s email (case-insensitive search).

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the criteria.

Return type:

list[src.schemas.schemas.ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Retrieves a single contact by its ID for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The unique identifier of the contact. Must be a positive integer.

  • current_user (src.entity.models.User) – The authenticated user. Defaults to auth_service.get_current_user.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 Not Found if the contact does not exist or does not belong to the current user.

Returns:

The found contact.

Return type:

src.schemas.schemas.ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(request: Request, body: ContactSchema, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Creates a new contact for the current user.

This endpoint adds a new contact to the database. It is rate-limited to 3 requests per minute.

Parameters:

  • request (fastapi.Request) – The incoming request object for rate limiting.

  • body (src.schemas.schemas.ContactSchema) – The contact data to be created.

  • current_user (src.entity.models.User) – The authenticated user. Defaults to auth_service.get_current_user.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 409 Conflict if a contact with the same email already exists for the user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

src.schemas.schemas.ContactResponse

Retrieves contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next 7 days for the current user.

This endpoint identifies contacts whose birthdays fall within the next week, considering year-end transitions (December to January).

Parameters:

  • current_user (src.entity.models.User) – The authenticated user. Defaults to auth_service.get_current_user.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list[src.schemas.schemas.ContactResponse]

REST API routes USERS¶

src.routes.users.get_user_avatar(user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Retrieves the avatar URL for a specific user.

This endpoint fetches the avatar URL associated with a given user ID.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The unique identifier of the user.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 Not Found if the user or their avatar is not found.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the user ID and avatar URL.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Updates the avatar for the currently authenticated user.

This endpoint allows an authenticated user to upload a new avatar. It performs validation on file type and size before uploading to Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • file (fastapi.UploadFile) – The avatar image file to upload.

  • current_user (src.entity.models.User) – The authenticated user whose avatar will be updated. Defaults to auth_service.get_current_user.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 400 Bad Request if the file type is unsupported or the file size exceeds the limit.

Returns:

A dictionary indicating the success of the update and the new avatar URL.

Return type:

dict

REST API SCHEMAS¶

class src.schemas.schemas.ContactSchema(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: EmailStr, phone_number: str, birthday: date, additional_info: str | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Schema for creating and updating contact information.

This schema defines the required fields for submitting contact details to the API.

Parameters:

  • first_name (str) – The first name of the contact.

  • last_name (str) – The last name of the contact.

  • email (pydantic.EmailStr) – The email address of the contact. Must be a valid email format.

  • phone_number (str) – The phone number of the contact.

  • birthday (datetime.date) – The birthday of the contact in YYYY-MM-DD format.

  • additional_info (str, optional) – Optional additional information or notes about the contact.

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Hash[source]¶

Bases: object

Utility class for password hashing and verification.

This class provides methods to hash plain text passwords using bcrypt and verify if a given plain password matches a hashed one.

pwd_context = <MagicMock name='mock.CryptContext()' id='1843819307248'>¶
verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool[source]¶

Verifies a plain text password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if the plain password matches the hashed password, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

password (str) – The plain text password to hash.

The bcrypt hashed password.

class src.services.auth.Auth[source]¶

Bases: object

Service class for user authentication, JWT token management, and email verification.

This class encapsulates logic for creating and verifying JWT access and refresh tokens, managing user sessions, and handling email confirmation.

SECRET_KEY = 'super-secret-key'¶
ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str[source]¶

Creates a new JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing data to encode into the token (e.g., {“sub”: user_email}).

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional expiration time in seconds. Defaults to 900 seconds (15 minutes).

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str[source]¶

Creates a new JWT refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – A dictionary containing data to encode into the token (e.g., {“sub”: user_email}).

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional expiration time in seconds. Defaults to 604800 seconds (7 days).

Returns:

The encoded JWT refresh token.

Return type:

str

async get_email_form_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str[source]¶

Decodes a refresh token and extracts the user’s email.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token string.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized if the token is invalid or has an incorrect scope.

Returns:

The email address (subject) from the token.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → User[source]¶

Dependency function to retrieve the current authenticated user.

This function decodes the access token, validates it, and fetches the corresponding user from the database. It is used as a FastAPI dependency for protected routes.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT access token provided in the Authorization header. Defaults to oauth2_scheme.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session. Defaults to get_db.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 Unauthorized if credentials are invalid or the user is not found.

Returns:

The authenticated User object.

Return type:

src.entity.models.User

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db (sqlalchemy.orm.Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The User object if found, otherwise None.

REST API services Cloudinary¶

src.services.cloudinary_service.upload_avatar(file_path: str, public_id: str) → str[source]¶

Uploads an avatar image to Cloudinary.

This function configures Cloudinary with credentials from settings and then uploads the specified image file, setting it as an avatar. It overwrites existing images with the same public_id in the ‘avatars’ folder.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str) – The local path to the image file to be uploaded.

  • public_id (str) – The unique identifier for the image in Cloudinary. Typically, this should be related to the user ID.

Returns:

The secure URL of the uploaded avatar image.

Return type:

str

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)[source]¶

Sends an email to confirm user registration.

This asynchronous function generates an email verification token, constructs an email message using an HTML template, and sends it to the specified recipient.

Parameters:

  • email (pydantic.EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient, used in the email template.

  • host (str) – The base URL of the application, used to construct the verification link.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there’s an issue connecting to the mail server.
